wikipedia_page.main: John Wilfrid Jackson (15 June 1880 – 1978) was a British conchologist, archaeologist and geologist.

response: *J. Wilfrid Jackson, conchologist, archaeologist and geologist.
* J. Wilfrid Jackson (1880–1978), British geologist and paleontologist

Later scholars have pursued the validity of the thesis. Yanagita had reproduced a distribution map of the usage of ornamental cowries throughout Asia (compiled by J. Wilfrid Jackson), [1950] §3. Map taken from Jackson (1917) Shells as Evidence of the Migrations of Early Culture. and Japanese ethnologist  alluded to a need for a distribution map of ornamental Job's tears, for making comparison therewith.Cf. , visual map of necklaces, and references to Yanagita elsewhere in the Newsletter.
* J. Wilfrid Jackson, British conchologist, archaeologist and geologist.
